title: React 16 className reconciliation problem - classNames not updated on render despite changing.
body:
**Do you want to request a *feature* or report a *bug*?** Report a Bug **What is the current behavior?** Hi! I have just come across what _looks_ like a bug with react reconciliation when rendering in a browser over an existing version of the same component (rendered on the server). This appears to only happen in react and react-dom 16, I have tried 16.4.1, 16.4.0, and 16.0.0 and all display the same behaviour. Whereas react & react-dom 15 seem to work as expected. If we take this (simple but rather contrived) component as an example: Header.js ```javascript import React from 'react'; export default (props) => { const classes = `header--${props.name}`; return (

{props.name}

); } ``` Then server side render it like so: ```javascript import {renderToString} from 'react'; import Header from '../Header'; renderToString(
); ``` we get something like the below: ```html

leonardo

``` Then, later, in the browser: ```javascript import ReactDom from 'react-dom'; import Header from '../Header'; const mount = document.getElementById('the-mount'); ReactDom.render(
, mount); ``` the component updates to: ```html

donatello

``` Note, the class value has not changed despite being driven by the same prop as the `

` content which _has_ updated, and so is now incorrect. **What is the expected behavior?** I would expect to see the following after the render call in the browser: ```html

donatello

``` **Which versions of React, and which browser / OS are affected by this issue? Did this work in previous versions of React?** I can replicate this in multiple versions of react and react-dom 16, however I see the expected behaviour in 15.
